original: BRACKE, Adolf Ossian (Bräcke), överingenjör, Nockeby, f Gävle 17/12 77 av sjökapt Ad Bräcke o Sally Norbeck, gm Ketty Norman. Mogenh.ex NReal 96, KTH (maskinbygg o mek tek) 96—99, bergsvetensk 00. Elev på Jernkont :s stat 01; rit o ing Hagfors Jvk 01—02; övering.ass AB Nord Artilleriverkstäd Finspång 02—03; Komm.koll :s stip Skottl, Engl o USA 04—06 därund ing v W Beardmore & Co:s stålgjuteri, Parkhead Forge & Rolling Mills’ d:o, Glasgow, Skottl, konstr.ch v Shelby Steel Tube & Co, Shelby, O, o Ellwod City, Pä, USA, 05; konstr.ch o övering.ass i samma bol 06—09; övering o driftsing v Phoenix, AG f Bergbau u Hiittenbetrieb, Abteilung Dusseldorf, 10—18; disp.ass o övering Storfors Br AB 18; övering o pl.chef v Uddeholms AB, Storforsvkn, 19—36; konsult v detta bol:s Storforsverk sed. 36, nu pensionerad. Led Sv Tekn.frn, Iron & Steel Inst o Verein Deutscher Eisenhuttenleute.
translated: BRACKE, Adolf Ossian (Bräcke), chief engineer, Nockeby, born Gävle 17/12 77, son of ship captain Ad Bräcke and Sally Norbeck, married to Ketty Norman. Completed secondary education at NReal in 96, studied mechanical engineering at KTH from 96 to 99, and mining engineering from 00. Apprentice at Jernkont :s state in 01; drafting and engineering at Hagfors Jvk from 01 to 02; assistant chief engineer at AB Nord Artilleriverkstäd Finspång from 02 to 03; Fellow of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering's scholarship in Scotland, England, and the USA from 04 to 06, during which he worked for W Beardmore & Co's steel foundry in Parkhead Forge & Rolling Mills in Glasgow, Scotland, as a design engineer at Shelby Steel Tube & Co in Shelby, Ohio, and Ellwod City, Pennsylvania, USA, 05; design engineer and assistant chief engineer at the same company from 06 to 09; chief engineer and head of operations at Phoenix, AG f Bergbau u Hiittenbetrieb, Abteilung Dusseldorf, from 10 to 18; assistant dispatcher and chief engineer at Storfors Br AB in 18; chief engineer and plant manager at Uddeholms AB, Storforsvkn, from 19 to 36; consultant at the Storfors power plant of this company since 36, now retired. Member of the Swedish Society of Engineers, Iron & Steel Institute, and Verein Deutscher Eisenhüttenleute.

structured.name: Adolf Ossian Bräcke
structured.description: Chief engineer Adolf Ossian Bräcke was born on December 17, 1877 in Gävle. His father, Captain Ad Bräcke, and his mother, Sally Norbeck, were his parents. He was married to Ketty Norman. He completed his secondary education at NReal in 1896, then studied mechanical engineering at KTH from 1896 to 1899 and later pursued mining engineering. He apprenticed at Jernkont's state in 1901 and worked as a draftsman and engineer at Hagfors Jvk from 1901 to 1902. From 1902 to 1903, he served as an assistant chief engineer at AB Nord Artilleriverkstäd Finspång. In the years 1904 to 1906, he was awarded the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering's scholarship, during which he worked at various locations in Scotland, England, and the USA. Some notable positions he held include working at W Beardmore & Co's steel foundry in Parkhead Forge & Rolling Mills, Glasgow, Scotland, and also as a design engineer at Shelby Steel Tube & Co in Shelby, Ohio, and Ellwod City, Pennsylvania, USA (in 1905). He continued with the same company as a design engineer and assistant chief engineer from 1906 to 1909. From 1910 to 1918, Bräcke served as the chief engineer and head of operations at Phoenix, AG f Bergbau u Hiittenbetrieb, Abteilung Dusseldorf. In 1918, he took up the role of assistant dispatcher and chief engineer at Storfors Br AB. From 1919 to 1936, he became the chief engineer and plant manager at Uddeholms AB, Storforsvkn. After retiring, he worked as a consultant at Storfors power plant. Adolf Ossian Bräcke was a member of the Swedish Society of Engineers, Iron & Steel Institute, and Verein Deutscher Eisenhüttenleute.

career.workplace: W Beardmore & Co's steel foundry, Parkhead Forge & Rolling Mills

career.occupational_title: Chief Engineer and Head of Operations
career.workplace: Phoenix, AG f Bergbau u Hiittenbetrieb, Abteilung Dusseldorf
